newsitem.title: UK: UPS expands European internet country page.
newsitem.headline: UPS expands European internet country page.

text.p: United Parcel Service of America said it has expanded its European Internet facilities, adding eight new country pages in local languages to the five launched in October 1996.
Country pages for Austria, Switzerland, Belgium, the Netherlands, Denmark, and Sweden are now available in addition to the existing European pages of France, Germany, Italy, Spain and UK.
Pages for Portugal and Ireland will soon be available, while it will also be possible to access service information in Catalan via the Spanish page, it said.
UPS' global web site (http:/www.ups.com) gives customers round-the-clock access to details on its worldwide services as well as package and document tracking facilities, it added.
"Our customers regard the transfer and availability of shipping information as important as the physical delivery itself," said Nigel Watson, vice president information services, UPS Europe.

"The fact that our global home page registers almost 400,000 hits a day, reflects the increasing role the Internet plays in today's business environment," he added. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
